Detailed Description

Remarks:
A simple class for performing some basic string operations.

Member Function Documentation

Note:
This is lifted from the draper library.

static size_t cmd::StringUtil::split ( const std::string &  src,
const std::string &  delim,
std::vector< std::string > &  results,
bool  addEmptyStrings = false 
) [inline, static]

Split a string into substrings based on a specified delimiter.

Parameters:
src Source string to be split
delim String containing delimiter characters (there can be multiple delimiters)
results Vector containing the substrings which will be returned
addEmptyStrings Indicates if empty strings should be included in the results array
Returns:
Number of delimiters found (not the number of substrings)

static std::string cmd::StringUtil::FixPath ( const std::string &  path  )  [inline, static]

Fix the delimiters in a path. Windows uses the backslash, but most others use the forward slash (Windows is actually fine with both.)

std::string *  path,
std::string *  filename 
) [inline, static]

Split a string into the path and filename. The returned path is guaranteed to have and end slash.
